snippet: At least two people were reported killed in sectarian clashes in the Mediterranean port of Sidon, underscoring the Syrian conflict’s effects in Lebanon.
abstract: Violent sectarian spillover from Syrian conflict reaches across southern Lebanon, with armed clashes by rival groups of Sunni and Shiite militia members in Mediterranean port of Sidon; violence leaves at least two people dead and forces Lebanese Army to seal off the area.

byline.original: By HANIA MOURTADA and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hania Mourtada reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: At least two people were reported killed in sectarian clashes in the Mediterranean port of Sidon, underscoring the Syrian conflict’s effects in Lebanon.

headline.main: Syrian Tensions Spill Into a City in Southern Lebanon
headline.print_headline: Syrian Tensions Spill Into a City in Southern Lebanon

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
